Stefan Boettcher

  • Endereço para acessar este CV: http://lattes.cnpq.br/9544012170696862
  • Última atualização do currículo em 28/11/2018


My fields of interest are Statistical Physics, Computational Physics and Quantum Computation.

My Publications                My Homepage

I received my Ph. D. from Washington University in St. Louis, in 1993 with Prof. Carl M. Bender. Before that, I had obtained a Diplom degree from Kiel University in Germany. From 1993 to 1998 I held postdoctoral positions at Brookhaven National Laboratory, University of Oklahoma, and as a Director's Fellow at the Center for Nonlinear Studies (CNLS) at Los Alamos National Laboratory. I joined the Department of Physics at Emory University in 1998 as a lecturer, was appointed assistant professor in 2003, associate professor in 2009, and professor in 2016. I have been chair of the Physics Department at Emory University since 2018.
In 2009-2010, I spent a sabbatical as a Fulbright Research Fellow in Germany. In 2013-2014, I was a visiting professor at the South Danish University sponsored by the Villum Foundation. From 2014-2017, I was a visiting professor in the Ciencia Sem Fronteiras program at the Laboratório Nacional de Computação Científica (LNCC) in Petropolis. In 2018, I was the Fulbright-FACEPE Distinguished Chair at UFPE in Pernambuco. In 2018, I was also elected Fellow of the American Physical Society. (Texto informado pelo autor)

Projetos de pesquisa
2012 - 2016
Structures and Dynamics in Disordered Systems
Descrição: This grant supports theoretical and computational research on hierarchically structured systems and aging in glasses..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (0) / Especialização: (0) / Mestrado acadêmico: (0) / Mestrado profissional: (0) / Doutorado: (2) .

Integrantes: Stefan Boettcher - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): National Science Foundation - Outra.
Número de produções C, T & A: 1
2008 - 2012
New Numerical and Theoretical Methods to Analyse Disordered Materials
Descrição: This grant supports computational and theoretical research on the low-temperature properties of spin glasses and models inspired by strongly disordered materials..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (0) / Especialização: (0) / Mestrado acadêmico: (0) / Mestrado profissional: (0) / Doutorado: (2) .

Integrantes: Stefan Boettcher - Coordenador.
Financiador(es): National Science Foundation - Outra.
Número de produções C, T & A: 16 / Número de orientações: 1
2003 - 2007
Large-Scale Applications and Theory of Extremal Optimization
Descrição: This grant supports the application of the extremal optimization heuristic, developed by the PI, to hard optimization problems, ranging from the physics of disordered materials to combinatorial problems in computer science and artificial intelligence..
Situação: Concluído; Natureza: Pesquisa.
Alunos envolvidos: Graduação: (0) / Especialização: (0) / Mestrado acadêmico: (0) / Mestrado profissional: (0) / Doutorado: (1) .
